ca.weblite.codename1.db

Class DAO<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.weblite.codename1.db.DAO<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Class type of the POJO model object.

    public abstract class DAO<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Data access object for a single table. You can implement a separate DAO for each table of the database. Currently tables must have an auto increment column named "id" in order to be compatible with this class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DAO.ColType
      Enum type for a column type in the DAO.
      protected class  DAO.Wrapper
      A wrapper class for the POJO model object.

      • getProvider

        public DAOProvider getProvider()
        Returns the DAOProvider that this DAO is a member of.
        Returns:

      • getById

        public final T getById(long id)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Gets an entity object by its ID. This version only checks the cache. If you want to check the database, you should use getById(long,boolean).
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the object.
        Returns:
        The entity object with the given ID or null if it isn't already loaded and cached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAll

        public java.util.List<T> getAll()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Gets all of the entities in this DAO that are currently cached. Please note, that the cache only stores weak references to the entities, so this is not a reliable way to store a set of objects for caching and retrieval.

        Use fetchAll() to fetch all of the items from the data source.

        Returns:
        A List of all of the entities that are currently cached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        fetchAll()

      • fetchAll

        public final java.util.List<T> fetchAll()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Fetches all of the entities in the underlying table as entity objects.
        Returns:
        List of entities.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fetch

        public final java.util.List<T> fetch(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> query)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Fetches a set of entities from the underlying table that match a given query.
        Parameters:
        query - A field=>value mapping the constitutes a query.
        Returns:
        A set of entities from the underlying table.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fetch

        public final java.util.List<T> fetch(java.lang.String[] query)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Fetches a set of entities from the underlying table that match a given query. This is a wrapper for fetch(java.util.Map) that juse uses a String[] array to pass the query instead of a Map.
        Parameters:
        query - Query parameters. Odd indices contain column names, Even indices contain column values.
        Returns:
        List of entities in the underlying table that match the query.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An entity object, or null if none was found.

      • getById

        public T getById(long id,
        boolean refresh)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Gets an entity by ID. If the refresh parameter is false, then this will only check the cache. If it is true, then this will reload the entity from the database, and update it's data.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the entity to load.
        refresh - True to refresh from the database. False to just load from cache.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fetchAll

        protected java.util.List<T> fetchAll(java.lang.String sqlQuery,
                         java.lang.String[] params)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Fetches records from the database using a specified SQL query. This is protected as an encouragement for implementors to create a finite set of fetchXXX methods in the subclass for performing specific searches, rather than exposing SQL to the caller.
        Parameters:
        sqlQuery - The SQL query
        params - The SQL query params
        Returns:
        List of entity objects.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • insert

        public void insert(T object)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Inserts an entity into the database. This will fail if the entity is already inserted.
        Parameters:
        object - The entity object to insert.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:

      • save

        public void save(T object)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves an entity to the database. This will check to see if the entity exists already, and will call update() if not. It will call insert() if it doesn't exist yet.
        Parameters:
        object - The entity object to save.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setDirty

        public void setDirty(T object,
            boolean dirty)
        Updates the dirty flag of the given entity object.
        Parameters:
        object - The entity object to apply the flag to.
        dirty - True to make the object dirty. False to make it clean.

        Gets the ID of a provided entity object. Should be implemented by a subclass.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The ID of the provided entity object.

      • db

      • importSet

        public void importSet(java.util.Map set,
             java.lang.String selector,
             java.util.Map columnMap,
             java.lang.String[] keyCols)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Imports a set of rows into the table.
        Parameters:
        set - A Map with a nested data structure. Typically this will have been parsed from JSON.
        selector - A selector path to indicate where, within the dataset, the rows to be imported are located. E.g. "tables/data" indicates that the Map set has a key "tables" with another Map, which contains a key "data", which is a List of Maps - each of which represents a row to be imported.
        columnMap - Maps columns in the imported set, into the corresponding column names in the table.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
